revised_title: Observations of the Eclipses of the Moon and the Sun in 1749
tldr: In this letter, Christopher Maire shares his observations of the lunar and solar eclipses that occurred in December 1749 and January 1750. He describes the challenging weather conditions and technical issues he faced during the observations. Despite these challenges, he managed to record valuable data using a 7-foot telescope and a micrometer. His observations were intended to be communicated to the Royal Society.
